pros: Career Connect is a fantastic organisation to work for. People focused, flexible , range of contracts and exciting opportunities for progression.
cons: Worked for the organisation for 8 years and haven't come across one!

job_title: Youth Voice Co-ordinator  in Liverpool, England
pros: - Supportive managers who thank you for your hard work and want to see you progress and develop - Flexible working hours and hybrid working - adaptive workforce to support additional needs - Additional perks such as free fruit, coffee and a perks point system - Reimburse expenses - Various training opportunities - Staff are passionate about the work we do - Neurodiversity support group - Freebies
cons: -Limited staff enrichment - it's a wide charity and very rare that events/sessions are held with all staff across the organisation - Takes time to move with innovation - it is happening but slowly

job_title: Case Manager in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Hands down the most thoughtful, employee focused company I have ever worked for
cons: I honestly can’t think of a single negative.

pros: I found my time at Career Connect to be a very positive experience. I was part of the GM ETE Team and found the whole team, management and HR staff to be incredibly welcoming and supportive. The whole Team work really well together and support each other to achieve positive results.
cons: It was only due to a change in my personal circumstances that I had to leave - this is a wonderful, personable Company who really do care about their staff and I would highly recommend them as an Employer.

job_title: New Business Manager in Liverpool, England

review_title: A warm welcome and great induction

review_title: a great company to work for

review_title: Great charity with excellent vision and values

review_title: A great company to work for
job_title: Trainee Careers Adviser in Liverpool, England
pros: A chance to do a level 6 qualification whilst earning a generous wage where many other employers would offer far less. A 35-hr working week with flexibility. A comfortable office with great transport links and also the opportunity to work from home. Very welcoming and helpful colleagues.
cons: It would be nice to meet as a team. As a new starter I have reached out to my adviser colleagues to understand their roles with only a handful getting back to me. Although I do understand it may be harder to get to know colleagues with the flexible working arrangements and people working on a number of different projects.

review_title: A great company to work for!
job_title: Finance & Internal Audit Manager in Liverpool, England
pros: Career Connect is a great company, that clearly cares about it's people. As a charity that helps young people and adults better themselves, they provide the same opportunities to their own staff, including training opportunities, flexible working, hybrid working and other great benefits
cons: I've worker here for 20 years, can't too many downsides!

pros: Colleagues are really supportive, job is varied and interesting, had regular pay rises, Birthday Leave, Chance to progress, feel valued.
cons: There are no training opportunities offered or paid for.

pros: I've worked in many organisations and this is a really great place to work! Everyone is friendly, welcoming and supportive. A great team working together for the greater good. pros:
Colleagues are very supportive and management takes interest in creating a great working environment for employees.

 Great induction process in place. There are also opportunities for progression within the organisation and management's always open to suggestions from all employees.
cons: It did take a while to get use to support structure and the different roles in within the team I'm working with. Everyone was so supportive despite me asking the same question over 10x 😆.

pros: Able to support some of the most vulnerable young people in our area to take steps towards achieving their goals and being part of making a difference in their lives. Recently the charity have been able to invest a little more in their staff, offering better quality Certified training, as opposed to online regulatory 'refresher' training that we've had for a number of years. Immediate line management absolutely and genuinely care about their staff (in my area, at least).
cons: Working for a charity means the pay isn't great, however, a commitment/promise from senior management to address this in 2022 has us hopeful of a small pay rise after a number of years without even a cost of living rise.

pros: None , terrible pay, 9 percent pay cut 10 years ago & no pay rises since, complete stagnation whist senior mgr salaries rise & rise with no competency. Supposed to be a charity, joke of an organisation
cons: Where to start... Too many. Disorganization lack of forward planning, no decent strategy except increase money for smt in terms of ppr.Ppr for what though ??? Totally incompetent. Culture of jobs for the boys. No care of staff, thrown to the wolves & often left with appalling work conditions but as long as contracts are met they do not care. Even now forcing staff out of only decent thing left greater merseyside pension scheme via fire & rehire. Absolutely no social conscience.

pros:
The work is fulfilling and you really do feel that you make a difference in peoples lives.
There is no micro management and you are trusted to get on with your work. 
Birthday leave is a good perk and the chance to do further training is great
cons: IT equipment could do with updating.

pros: Everyone here is friendly and welcoming, they are hard workers and will always help if needed, over all its a fantastic place to work.
cons: There have been no down sides to working here

pros:
Friendly, experienced and passionate team. The Wirral Team have a wide variety of experience dealing with Young People and the issues they face. Since joining the team, I have witnessed each and every member of staff proactively working above and beyond expectations to ensure a Young Person can access Employment, Education or Training.
Management are approachable but do not micro manage.
cons: The outsourced IT proves difficult when trouble shooting or setting up IT (phone & laptops).

cons: The salary is not the best on offer, but job satisfaction and flexible working conditions are equally important.

On the job training. Supportive team helping me through IAG qualification 
Current team generally supportive 
Company have taken everyone's well being into consideration at this current time of lock down

More explanation required for how appraisals work and how to prepare for them

review_title: A careers charity supporting better life chances for young people and adults
job_title: Team Leader in Salford, North West England, England
pros: Career Connect is a charity supporting better outcomes and life chances for a broad range of clients through delivery of quality and impartial careers information, advice, guidance and support. We are an organisation passionate about raising aspirations in our client groups and helping them to achieve better outcomes in training and work through overcoming the barriers to employment and supporting personal and professional development. The charity's greatest asset is our people; a team of professional and highly skilled careers advisers and employment coaches who are passionate about the work we do and removing barriers to progression for our clients. Our staff are dedicated, flexible and innovative in their work, achieving great outcomes for our clients who are often disadvantaged or experiencing significant barriers to their progression. This is a friendly place to work where people support each other and take pride in the services we deliver.
cons: The commissioning and funding models for our services can often mean that contracts are short-term (1-3 years) with no guarantee of onward funding. However, our teams are flexible and adaptable and the silver lining in the contracts model can mean more opportunities for employees' professional development and progression.

review_title: A modern, forward-thinking and progressive employer
job_title: Digital Marketing Officer in Liverpool, England
pros:
Located in city centre location, very well served by public transport. Modern, airy offices with great views across the city. The place has a good team feeling and while work is busy and fast-paced, staff are friendly and relaxed.
During COVID-19, company has been quick and eager to adopt new flexible working practices and supportive of safe working practices. 
Induction training is comprehensive and thorough, with e-learning modules, company intranet and use of software to ensure staff are able to engage with the process of developing good working practices.
Company management are supporting of staff continual development and helping to source appropriate support to enable staff members to perform to the best of their abilities.
cons: Liverpool city centre location (head office) means parking is a challenge but there are plenty of car parking facilities and public transport stops within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Public transport recommended.

review_title: A charity with a commitment to serving local communities
pros: An organisation with an ethical purpose and and clear objective to support the local communities and clients they work with.  Career Connect offers employees the opportunity to deliver innovative services to some of the most vulnerable members of society via a broad range of contract specialisms.  As a result Career Connect employees have the opportunity to develop a broad range of skills needed for career progression within the charitable sector.
cons: Charitable funding mechanisms are often short term and therefore this can result in fast evolving landscape which requires a great deal of flexibility and the ability to understand many competing priorities

pros:
I have worked at Career Connect now for 6 years and still enjoy the work that I do and going to work.

Some of the great benefits working at Career Connect are:
Flexi-Time, giving that all important work/life balance
Enhanced maternity pay terms
Generous annual leave entitlement starting at 25 days leave (bank holidays in addition
And just a great friendly place to work. All teams have a real team spirit and management are supportive and listen to feedback.
cons: HQ parking can be difficult so public transport is better. But if you are disabled and have a Blue Badge, parking and accessibility is not an issue

pros:
Like minded staff, all customer focused with the aim to motivate individuals, helping people to recognize their potential & gain success.
Flexible working pattern which fits in with my family life. Plenty of holidays too!
Able to access further training in my role to help me develop & progress.
Helpful managers, easy to talk to and always there if you have any issues or problems. New initiatives come in all the time which keeps the job interesting.
Having been in my role for over 10 years speaks volumes :-)
cons: No free parking at HQ but I work remotely so this doesn't affect me much and can claim it back.

job_title: Lead Operational Manager in Liverpool, England
pros: People ask me why i've stayed with Career Connect for over 17 years and my answer is easy! they have provided me a with career growth opportunities, good benefits and salary but most importantly to me is the honest open communication between staff and management and the decision making processes involving all staff.
cons: The office location is in city centre so sometimes more difficult to park nearer the office

pros: Good colleagues. Flexible working and flexi-time. Generous holidays. Autonomy for work and caseload.
cons: In the beginning: Lots of training, personal development, opportunity to progress, good salary with incremental progression and regular cost of living rises. Towards the end: Lack of training and personal development, lack of opportunities to progress, salary reductions/ pay cut and no cost of living rise for over 10 years.

job_title: Careers Adviser in Salford, North West England, England
pros: Career Connect are a supportive employer who offer flexible working, which helps with a family/ work life balance. Colleagues all help each other and are passionate about the work that they do. As a long term member of staff, I still enjoy coming to work!
cons: Contracts can sometimes be short term which can cause some job uncertainty, however this is the case in most similar types of work.

review_title: Great place to work with a great team around you

cons: The work can be challenging at times but the team members always support each other
